page.title: 07LYDFORD FORESTRY
page.content: We left school about9.30 I went in Mr Friend's car to the Lydford Forestry. Mr Friend is a Forestry Commission Ranger. When we got there we went to see some trees first. Then we came back to get Spruce Karen's dog, then we went for our walk through the Forestry. Most of the trees are coniferous like Douglas Fir, Norway Spruce, Sikta Spruce Japanese Spruce and Southern Beech. When they are fully grown they are about 100 feet.This takes about 100 years so they are fast growers. The soft wood is used for Paper and Fencing. There is an Iron Age Fort in the Lydford Forestry. It has recently been discovered because the trees blocked the view. It is about 2000 years old. There are some red Deer in the Lydford Forestry but we did not see any there.
